diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Acute Kidney Injury, Coagulopathy with elevated INR, Liver Disease, Acute on Chronic Diastolic Heart Failure, Retroperitoneal Hematoma, Not specified
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with hypotension, elevated INR, jaundice, and acute kidney injury. Imaging studies revealed a retroperitoneal hematoma and signs of cholecystitis, further supported by the clinical picture of abdominal discomfort. The presence of bandemia and other systemic signs indicated an acute process, leading to the diagnosis of acalculous cholecystitis.
